From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To purge the configuration logging database entries, use the **clear archive log config** command in privileged EXEC mode.
CLIs: clear archive log config [ force | persistent ]

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Eliminates the confirm step before the contents of the archive log are cleared.
(Optional) Purges the configuration logging persistent-command database entries.

Examples: The following example clears the database entries that have been saved to the config log without asking you to confirm the action before the entries are cleared:
Router# clear archive log config force
ExtraInfo: When the **clear archive log config** command is entered, only the entries in the configuration logging database file are deleted. The file itself is not deleted; it will be used in the future to log new entries as they occur.

RelatedCmds.description: Displays the persisted commands in configlet format.
